dialogues.text: And this is evil?  The guy had an aneurysm and now he's in a coma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's their explanation.  You might not believe me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why should I? (beat) Alright, what's your name, where do you live, when did you kill your parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya doesn't answer.  Peter stops at a red light.  A pick truck full of teenagers with a young girl at the wheel, R BLASTING SOUL MUSIC, pulls up next to them. Maya uses the moment to get out and walk quickly away.  Peter watches h go for a moment, then stares at her paper coffee cup, pic up his cell and dials a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Smythe? (beat) Hey, Mike, it's Peter.  Could you pull some prints off something for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter rides the elevator in his building.  It stops and h gets off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter enters the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter moves into the bathroom.  Claire's sitting in front a mirror.  Her hair's up in a smooth twist, and all she's on is a bathrobe.  We note a photograph of Peter's mother sporting a similar hair style on the dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, guess which stylist just got this month's "Elle" cover?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter runs a hand through his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half-heartedly) You're amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire smiles, in her own world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up, you don't want to be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glittering Italianate chandelier.  As we look down we S Men in black tie and women in high fashion chic form a mo of money and power beneath the chandelier's blazing light A lavish publisher's party is underway in the hotel's ballroom.  In one corner, a CROWD hovers around Peter and Claire, the quintessential perfect couple. She's in a dramatic skintight dress.  He looks great in t latest tux.  Adrenaline BUZZ of admiration has soothed Pe but he's still distracted.  Claire, however, is her outgo self.  William in a rented tux and Susan, in a modest gow hang on the edge of the golden crowd.  A JADED YOUNG MAN leading the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear how the TIMES zinged Paul Guenette's new book?  They said "He writes for the ages - between five and twelve."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone enjoys that remark.  A gorgeous woman named LAUR moves closer to Peter, flirting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you on the news.  But I think you're even better live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) He is.  By the way, Lauren, did you ever finish your book on tattoo art?  I hear your publisher wants his advance back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold) That's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Rhonda Huston's assistant was just made an editor at S&S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy with the weird fingernails?  Imagine looking over galleys with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Peter, how crowded is the field now?  There are, what, seven books in the offing about the Viznick case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but no one has the access I've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true the cops used a psychic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw a psychic once.  Some of these guys are definitely for real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, really?  I dropped $250 on a session once and they guy didn't get a thing right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you, Peter?  Where do you stand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wherever there's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter feels a tap on his shoulder.  A WAITER serving hors d'oeuvres is standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None for me, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter wipes the frame and as he does, John Townsend revealed, beads of sweat glistening on his brow and a gun his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) God will forgive me, the time of transformation is so near.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points it at Peter's face.  Peter is in shock.  Everyt around him seems to blur, except the gun floating a few f away.  But Townsend hesitates, obviously conflicted. And suddenly, the woman to Peter's left SCREAMS.  The waiter's tray goes flying.  With astonishing speed, Willi flings himself onto Townsend.  They both go down.  A SHOT RINGS OUT.  Pandemonium.  Screams & shouting.  Peter sees that William has Townsend in a brutal headlock.  Townsend looks panicked, helpless.  Peter is pulled back, as the t men disappear beneath a swarm of other bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The enormous room is empty.  All the guests are gone.  Th uneaten food and overturned chairs testimony to their has departure.  Peter, Claire, Susan and William are sitting semi-circle.  Smythe walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for handling this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing.  Look, I've got enough, between your preliminary statements and all the witness accounts.  You can go home. (to Peter) Gimme til morning.  Find out who he is.  Until then, don't sweat it, huh?  Just your random bad cheese trying to hole you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colloquialisms 101.  My only "A" in the Academy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter stands and pats Smythe on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks again for everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't thank me.  Somebody up there likes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter looks at William, then hugs him in a powerful embra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moved) Will, this is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smile, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we please leave now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Claire exit a limo.  The scaffolding is still i place but the workers are gone.  Josef pushes open the do for Peter and Claire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, Mr. Kelson.  Miss Claire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Claire enter the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgent) I want to tell you...your neighbor, Mrs. Levotsky, she's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Claire are both caught off guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  That's horrible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enjoyably ghoulish) Apparently she killed herself sometime last night. (confidentially) The paramedics told me she hung herself.  Climbed up on her dresser, stocking around her neck, but I don't know.  She was completely rheumatoid... (realizes he's speaking with too much relish) It's a shame.  Anyway, though you should know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's stunned and now completely unnerved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I appreciate it.  Thanks, Josef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frightened) When did they find her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few hours ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire's blown away by the night's events.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter has slowed to look at the yellow police cordon, as Claire moves on into their apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bit later, Peter and Claire, both still shaken, sit acr from a relieved Father James, drinking coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's moments like this that make it clear.  All that matters is those we love are with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's touched.  He pats James on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe Will killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire stands, exhausted.  She bends down, kissing Peter the cheek, only because James is there, and then she give Peter a sweet hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deeply felt) I don't know what I'd do without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter hugs her tightly.  An emotional moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to bed.  Don't be long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire exits.  James looks at Peter, sees the night's eve have taken their toll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something he said, just before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spoke to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  It didn't make any sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, Peter.  You can't let the ravings of a madman disturb you, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, but it's funny.  All my life I thought I was simply a man who didn't believe in any of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter, my son, he believes in you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's true.  I have no faith.  It's strange.  When that gun was pointed at my face tonight, I was surprised, but never frightened.  It was as if I knew nothing could possibly happen to me and...in that one moment I didn't care about anything.  Not eve my own life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter.  Your life must matter to you because it matters to all of us who love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I respect that you have such faith, James.  I don't understand it, but I want you to know that despite our differences, I admire you and I always will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father James stands and claps his hand on Peter's shoulde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate your saying that.  I'm gonna go now.  I believe you're wanted elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya is making coffee in a drip pot on a hot plate.  Ther a soft knock on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Jeremy enters and shuts the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His faith wavered.  He tried to shoot Kelson last night.  I don't know all the details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was anyone else hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A curious conflict of emotions passes across Maya's face sadness coupled with relief.  She sits heavily on the bed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful, Maya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hustle and bustle of a typical weekday morning.  As P crosses the street, nearing his office, suddenly a MESSEN on a bicycle skids and falls.  The Messenger's on the gro crashed, his mail everywhere.  Immediately Peter moves to help him up, grabbing an arm, trying to collect the spill envelopes.  All the morning PEDESTRIANS step over or arou the mess, in typical New York fashion.  The embarrassed Messenger thanks Peter, AD-LIB, and we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's typing at his computer.  He is surrounded by newspaper clippings, interview transcripts and other rese relevant to the Viznick trial.  His printer JAMS.  As he moves to fix it, the intercom blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Detective Smythe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're you doin' today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tough) It's another day.  I think I'm alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the right attitude, anyway, look, we gotta talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smythe exits the building just as Peter approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fed up inside, let's walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Smythe take a walk down the street.  Smythe sto moment at an outdoor vendor.  Buys a hotdog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We traced this guy to a seminary in Newark.  If you can believe it, he was a deacon. (shifting a file under his arm) Talked to the man in charge there, a Father Frank Page.  He said the gunman, John Townsend, was caught up in some nonsense about the Devil, along with a priest named Lareaux and a woman named Maya Larkin - the same woman whose prints were on that coffee cup.  Now can I please get the fill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smythe licks a mouthful of mustard just ready to drip, th takes a huge bite off his dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She came to me with a wild story about demonic possession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands Peter Maya's file) She's got a juvenile record from New Orleans.  Parents died when she was 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parents died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, murder-suicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother killed the father, then killed herself.  Crime of passion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told me she killed them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not what the records show.  Anyway, she was a runaway, arrests for vandalism, petty theft, drugs, the whole bit.  Parole records show she graduated from community college, moved into a retreat house, teaches some classes at the seminary school, hasn't been in any trouble since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smythe finishes his hot dog and chucks the wrapper into a nearby can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hauled her in earlier but didn't have anything hard to tie her to Townsend.  Far as the priest goes, he won't be bothering you.  Suffered a complete mental breakdown, during - get this - during an exorcism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had to let her go. (beat) I see you thinkin' there, superstar.  Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter drives into the Lincoln Tunnel.  Two men stand outs the entrance, arguing.  As Peter passes, they begin fight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure I don't have to remind you she's still a possible accessory to attempted murder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya stands before a roomful of children.  She holds an o sized picture of a hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Le Chapeau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tres bien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the obvious, you could get another gun in your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next is a picture of a dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Le Chien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I won't go anywhere near her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the hall is abruptly flung open.  Peter strid in.  Maya sees his anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (harsh) We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's overt belligerence scares the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions towards the door.  Maya turns to the class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Children, I'll be right back.  Just stay in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter grabs her and escorts her to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unconvincing smile) ...your seats.  Be right back.  Don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as she's pulled into the hall, we SEE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya, still holding the brightly colored vocabulary pictu stands with Peter in the hallway.  Opposite her in the ha is a window, and to the left, an old radiator with chippe enamel paint.  Next to the wall is a plain wooden bench.  Maya stands with her back to her classroom door.  She continually checks on her kids through a window in the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really pissed off) Last night a guy named John Townsend tried to shoot me and now I find out you knew him.  What the fuck is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter moves in close, crowding her against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lowering his voice) Why did he try to kill me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at classroom) Townsend believed, just as God became man in Christ. (Maya turns back to Peter) So Satan will assume human form.  I believe it too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter grabs the pictures out of her hand and pitches them into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the point is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the exorcism, Birdson boasted that Satan is about to take over the body of a man. (long pause) You are that man, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true.  Birdson knew your name, he was writing it in numerical code.  It wasn't easy but I figured it out.  It spelled your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Why didn't Birdson just say so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're possessed, you can't reveal anything Satan wants hidden.  Unless you trick him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (now completely unimpressed) Trick him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The good outwitting the bad.  It's like Birdson had a split personality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he's had it; laughs) You should think about getting professional help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're already contaminated.  It's why you couldn't hear the tape.  There's probably a pentacle near your bed.  To sanctify you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to be drawn into this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this sounds crazy.  I understand.  Check your parents' blood types.  Are you sure your parents are your birth parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents are dead.  Don't even think of bringing them into this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The school bell rings.  Within seconds, the hallway is flooded with kids and teachers. A smiling Father Frank stops out of a classroom.  As he s Maya and Peter down the hall, his face darkens.  He start towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving to Peter; whisper) You're about to become the anti-Christ who is born unholy and becomes the door to eternal suffering in this world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed off at himself now) If you or any of your lunatic friends ever come near me again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter notices Father Frank moving up on Maya and takes of  EXT. STREET - OUTSIDE SEMINARY - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An angry Peter walks to his Range Rover.  The wind is up it has started to rain.  Peter's under-dressed, hunching shoulders against the elements.  He's parked a distance f the Seminary.  As he begins a slow jog to his car, the ra begins to come down a bit harder.  Suddenly, Peter slips the wet pavement and falls, scraping his hand.  A moment, while he gets his bearings and then he picks himself up, rain now shooting down the side of his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An anxious Maya sits at her desk.  Suddenly, there's a ha knock on the door and Father Frank enters.  Maya looks up unprepared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had it.  Townsend's dead.  The police are calling and now I see you having a scene in front of the children.  I'm sorry, Maya, you've been with us for many years, but effective immediately, I'm rescinding your right to live at the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, I have nowhere else to stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a sister in New Orleans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya looks up at him, but Father Frank's out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Lareaux sleeps quietly, quasi fetal.  Maya moves t the room soundlessly.  A renewed sadness stabs her at the sight of Lareaux.  She studies him a moment, then cups hi face in her hands.  Slight disturbance in Lareaux's body, like a child's startle reaction.  Maya lets go and leaves quietly as she came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upscale.  Claire and Peter at lunch.  Peter is clearly agitated.  His clothes are still wet and pretty wrinkled. Claire looks at him with tenderness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna have to get a restraining order.  What a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  In a way, I'm glad it all happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter looks at her skeptically, a little pissed off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're glad somebody tried to kill me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous about confronting him) No, of course not, but I think now that this has happened, a lot of things can start to come out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still pissed) Yeah, like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming on a little stronger) Like you need to admit that losing your parents when you were twelve was traumatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unafraid) It's with me all the time, Claire, I just don't like to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it shattered your faith in everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to lighten it) I'm just temporarily off my game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (boring in) You need to believe in something besides yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe in you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment where Claire hesitates, then she decides to let herself be flattered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning in, close to Peter) I love you.  You look a mess.  Why don't you go home and clean up before you go back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire kisses Peter, brief but deep, as she gulps in a sh gust of air. Outside the rain has stopped as Claire gets up, taking of for work without him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya is sitting on an iron bench outside the playground. shoulder bag with some of her belongings lays beside her. She stands, picks up her sack and walks across the street a small diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's warm, crowded and NOISY.  WAITRESSES banter with longtime customers about the ups and downs of everyday li Maya enters in a state of complete distress.  She sits at counter next to a MOTHER and her LITTLE GIRL.  Their drin and sandwiches are spread out everywhere.  The little gir cusp her hand around a tall glass of milk.  She wears bla patent shoes, a red jacket, hood attached.  Maya bows her head and covers her eyes.  She's losing it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper) I can't do this anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little girl, about 4 years old, tugs on Maya's sleeve

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to put your napkin in your lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Gina!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya looks at the solemn little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to her mother) It's okay. (she puts her napkin in her lap) Better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, she's very into rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't your daughter put her napkin in her lap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) I don't have a daughter.  I'm not married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you lonely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Gina, that's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya sees the little girl wants an answer.  Moved, she be close and whispers in her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have someone who takes care of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls back.  The little girl looks up at Maya reprovingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cruelly) But he's dead.  Jesus is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then she smiles at Maya, a wicked smile.  Maya looks the little girl, and then at her mother.  The mother's ey are sparkling with malice.  The room begins to warp and distort.  And we hear a choked back breath. Horrified, Maya quickly turns in her chair and faces away from the vision, praying silently with eyes closed.  Afte moment, she opens her eyes.  The room looks normal again. the reflection of the mirror across the counter she sees the two seats next to her are empty, the utensils untouch Sighing with relief, she turns back.  But the little girl her mother are still there.  The mother's face suddenly l elongated, her eyes move too close together and her nose disappears.  A frightening distortion, but momentary.  An the little girl's smile widens with spite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a loud, frightened cry, Maya sweeps her arms out, knocking all the nearby glasses, utensils and dishes to t floor with a tremendous crash.  Milk bleeds over the coun All eyes turn to her.  Distraught, Maya sees the little g and the mother are gone.  She grabs her bag and runs out diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiet, shadowy.  The aquarium has begun a slow leak a small puddle of water has pooled beneath it.  Peter ent He notices the water on the floor.  He goes into the bedr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ledge of the building across the way can be seen from Peter's window.  A WOMAN is moving near the ledge, settin out a grouping of potted geraniums.  From downstairs, a s of light is visible. Peter changes his clothes  Then, he feels the scrape on h hand.  Looks at it.  As he moves to the bathroom.  Washes hand and as he does so, he checks his reflection in the mirror.  Stares at himself a moment, then sticks out his tongue.  Checks it.  And then dries his hand, moving back the bedroom, carrying his towel with him.  Peter glances his bed a moment.  Half-amused, he leans over and checks behind the picture hanging above the headboard. Nothing. Then, he bends down, checking under the bed.  Again, noth Then, he moves to a bedroom closet, pulling down a black gray speckled file box. Inside, a series of newspaper clippings, graphic photos.  Yellowed with age, on of which falls on the bed, titled, "Unsolved Brutal Murders."  Peter riffles past the clippi to the coroner's report. He speed reads it, until he gets to his parents' blood ty "Andrea Kelson - A negative."  Jack Kelson - O positive." Peter stares at the information.  Confused by what it's supposed to mean.  Then, he pulls on a turtleneck sweater ready to go back out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter exits the bedroom and steps back towards the living room, carrying the towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter passes through to his front door throwing his towel the puddle of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter walks in, eyeballing Mrs. Quintana's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good of you to stop by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breezy) We millionaires yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter enters to find Michael.  Peter sizes up the man who casually studying Peter's personal desk photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm, Melvin Szabo, this is Peter Kelson.  Peter, this is the psychic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stranger looks up.  He's young and cocky, with thick glasses.  He's holding a picture of Peter with his parent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Melvin) I'd appreciate it if you'd put that back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are the younger of two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts down that photo and picks up one of Claire, as Pe walks over to his chair and a position of more control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating Claire) You're afraid of committing to this girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter grabs one of his pens and begins rolling it between fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she worships you.  Your mother's dead but your father's alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing you couldn't find out from reading the papers.  And you're already wrong on one count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viznick will get off and Michael's got a crush on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael looks alarmed.  Peter notices his pen is leaking over his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what?  You can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suit yourself.  But does this mean anything to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melvin picks up a pen and writes "X-E-S" in florid script a pad.  He holds it out for Peter's inspection.  Peter is rattled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do know, don't you.  That these are also numbers.  Greek numbers, 600, 60 and 6 - or 666.  The sign of the Devil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleasantly) Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sticks out his hand and grabs Peter's.  His expression changes from one of amused disdain to fascinated curiosit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His arrogance melts away.  Melvin's face tightens.  A shu of fear passes through him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strangled gasp) God will forgive me...the time of transformation is so near.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the voice is that of John Townsend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really shaken) Get the fuck out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter stands in the middle of the sidewalk as the wind violently whips at his jacket.  He gazes upward to the mu gray sky.  Finally he lowers his eyes.  He sees something that angers him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sprawling Catholic church stands before him.  Peter reg it with wrath.  He pushes open the door and tries to ente but a group of LITHUANIAN parishioners pushes past him, blocking his way. A priest calls a farewell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Lithuanian) See you all next week!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entry finally clear, Peter goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark, forbidding.  The priest exits around a corner. Peter looks at the vast and spacious altar.  Above it is enormous wooden crucifix.  Peter moves down the aisle tow the altar.

dialogues.speaker: ECU
dialogues.text: The sorrowful face of the Christ figure looks down on Pet with pity.  The body hangs, gaunt, wracked with pain.  Th wrists pierced by nails, the feet cruelly hammered togeth Peter stops at the first pew.  He looks up at the crucifi Defiant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, do something.  Show me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waits.  For a split-second, there's a pristine silence Then the sound of the wind rises in the church.  With tha the right wrist SHATTERS with a noise like a rifle shot.  Freed from one of its supports, the heavy wooden Christ S FORWARD at an awkward angle.  The other wrist SNAPS IN TW For a second, the Christ figure trembles.  Then, with a sickening sound, the entire wooden body falls forward, sw sideways and PLUMMETS down.  Peter doesn't want to look. figure is now hanging upside down, held only by the brace its feet.  Above it, each hand remains pinned to the cros It's an EXACT COPY of Viznick's tattoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birdson's eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter staggers outside, dodging two DOGS fighting, a vici NOISY battle on the Rectory lawn.  And in the b.g., a homeless man takes a piss into a rivulet of white liquid. Peter walks in a daze, pulling his car keys from his pock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's car moves through traffic, driving slowly, erratically.  He scrapes a parked car, but doesn't stop, Corners poorly, almost hitting a pedestrian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter pulls up in his Range Rover across the street from playground.  He gets out of his car and crosses the stree As Peter walks closer, he sees Maya.  She's sitting on a swing, looking off into space, rocking ever-so-slightly b and forth, a pile of smoked, crushed cigarettes and her shoulder bag at her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing beside Maya is an agitated DAY-CARE WORKER.  The conversation is FAINTLY AUDIBLE.  Across the yard, a SECO DAY-CARE WORKER is shepherding the last of the kids back inside the center.  The children are carefree and rambunctious, unaware of the adult drama taking place aro them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, get them inside! (sympathetically to Maya) Look, you don't have a job here anymore.  They want you to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya's face.  She's devastated.  In the b.g., a YOUNG GIR does a triple on the roll bar.  Three girls and one boy compete for distance on the monkey bars. The Latino Boy and one of his friends LAUGH and break fre from the line heading back to the school.  They circle ba toward Maya and swoop by her, waving exuberantly, then re to the line and go into the school.  The day-care worker follows them as: Peter walks through the gate.  He walks fast toward Maya, sees him coming, from a distance.  Maya continues rocking ever so gently on her swing.  Peter puts out his hands an stops it.  Stares at her, scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lost) I don't understand what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no reason why you should. (tells him as gently as possible) This has been planned from your birth.  You fit all the criteria that we know of.  Never baptized, born of incest, devoid of faith...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I was baptized.  And I certainly wasn't born of incest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were not baptized.  At least I don't believe it was Christian.  Your baptism was performed by your uncle, James McKenzie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only baptism he ever performed in seven years as pastor at Bedford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven years.  One baptism?  He's your mother's only brother

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya stares at Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know your parents' blood types?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I looked at the coroner's report.  My father's O positive and my mother...A negative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking this in a gasp of air) Peter, your blood-type is AB negative.  There's no way your birth father can be O positive.  You father is not who you think he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really shaken) So...then the coroner's report is probably wrong.  I mean...this is ridiculous.  There's been a mistake.  I don't believe any of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That silences Peter.  He sits heavily in the swing next t her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, I believe your baptism was perverted.  Look at your certificate.  Your mother was the only witness to it.  Your blood-type doesn't match who you thought your father was.  Peter...I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate) And if what you're saying is true, what would happen to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. (beat) I do know that people who are possessed have to accept evil in some way.  I don't know if it works the same way in this instance.  I don't even know when it's going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter looks at Maya for solace, but there is none.  He glances away, runs a hand through his hair and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Townsend tried to kill me, he said something strange like... (struggles to remember) "The time of transformation is near..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting something together) Townsend, he had some of Father's books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As night falls, the Range Rover moves out of the suburbs deeper into the countryside.  There's a bright moon.  The highway is a ribbon of silver.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. RURAL ROAD- LATER THAT NIGHT
dialogues.text: Their car pulls up to a dirt driveway.  Bordered by saggi fences, the mail box reads "Townsend."  At the end of the driveway is a two-story, weather-beaten farmhouse with a garage.  There are no lights on.  Maya says a silent pray and steels herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ground floor windows are shuttered.  Maya tries the f door.  It's locked.  Peter walks to the end of the porch, looking for another entrance.  Maya looks at the door, th jams her elbow through a small pane of glass next to the doorknob, breaking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inward smile at Maya) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Maya enter the dark hall.  Peter reaches for a light switch and flips it on.  They see a hallway in fron them, stairs to the right and living room off to the left For a moment, they stand in silence.  Peter opens a close door, glancing inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking for exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The books themselves or maybe some pages he ripped out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya walks into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The furniture is shabby and worn.  There's a battered sof new TV and a coffee table.  Maya goes to the table and quickly looks through a pile of magazines.  Peter enters makes a fast tour of the room.  Maya gestures towards the entrance of an adjacent room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya turns on a standing lamp.  This room looks more promising.  There's an old piano in one corner.  On one w are two bookshelves.  And next to a set of wooden chairs small reading table.  Maya starts scanning the rows of bo Peter is immediately drawn to the table where he sees new copies of his books.  Chilled, Peter turns to Maya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got all my books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya looks over at Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We needed to know all we could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to look around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter crosses the hallway into the dining room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room's dominated by a long wooden dining table, cover with a chintz tablecloth.  The window shutters are open a moonlight streams in. Peter tries the light switch.  It doesn't work.  He walks around the room - and is spooked by a glimpse of movement It's his own reflection in a mirror.  He sees a closet do and opens it.  Inside, it's totally dark.  He pulls a han cord.  A light goes on revealing a small pantry filled wi canned goods, foodstuff. Peter goes to the other side of the pantry and opens anot door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya continues to comb through the bookshelves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter steps into a dingy kitchen.  A dirty coffee cup and plate sit on the counter near the sink.  At the other end the kitchen, past the refrigerator, is a door leading outside.  Peter approaches the door, glances through the window.  He then turns and walks through a doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter stands at the base of the rear staircase.  As he st to ascend the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) I'll be upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya is flipping through Peter's books.  Suddenly, she he the tread of footsteps overhead.  It startles her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reassuring herself) Peter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts down the book and turns around.  Surveying the r she sees an entrance to the hallway that services the mas bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya walks through the hall towards the open door of the master bedroom.  She goes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An antique oak bed dominates the room, with two suitcases lying on top.  The place is a mess - clothes strewn everywhere.  There's a roll-top desk in the corner with s books and papers on it.  One of Townsend's jackets is dra on the desk chair. On the opposite wall is a door that's open just a crack. interior of a bathroom is visible on the other side.  The door has a smoky, opaque window built into its top half. Maya starts sifting through the papers on the desk.  She hear Peter's footsteps moving slowly above her.  And the sound of doors opening. She opens the desk drawers.  The first one is stuffed wit bills.  The second has checkbooks, bank statements.  The third is stuck shut. Maya kneels down to get better leverage.  From this perspective, we can see the open door to the dark hallway behind her...She pulls and pulls again.  As the drawer po open, a shadow falls across her.  She WHIRLS.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: It's Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much upstairs  A couple of empty bedrooms and a bathroom.  Anything here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya looks at the contents of the drawer.  It's full of Christian literature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go outside and take a look in the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya nods.  Peter exits the room.  She hears his footstep fade away and a door slam.  As she stands up, she knocks Townsend's jacket off the chair.  A book falls out of a pocket.  It's on of the books Townsend took from Lareaux' room.  Maya opens it.

dialogues.speaker: ECU
dialogues.text: Tiny, cryptic notations are scrawled in the margins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter walks down the side steps and over to the large gar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An intrigued Maya turns another page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter enters.  Sees a switch.  Flips it on and a fluoresc light BUZZES ON.  He peruses old boxes, two dusty, black filing cabinets.  Ruston curtain rods, a box of broken appliances and an old stove covered with an orange tarp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Maya reads, she hears a light, SCRAPING noise.  She glances up.  Silence.  She waits.  Nervous, Maya then goe back to her book.  Excited, she spots something that's important.  She hears another light SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya listens.  She hears a few footsteps in the adjacent bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself) Jesus, Peter, you scared me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Book in hand, Maya walks over to the bathroom door and fl it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rushes in) Look at this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps into the bathroom and freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry Birdson is standing in the corner, same green regulation drawstring pants and matching T-shirt.  He has fish-gutting knife in his hand.  With an evil smile, he calmly steps forward, imitating the gesture Maya saw in t restroom at the seminary.  He raises his knife, holding i out in front of her.  Maya stands still.  She wants to ru more than anything in life, but she doesn't.  Instead, sh reaches out one hand and touches the knife ever so gently with the tips of her fingers.  Fro a second, neither one moves.  Maya's face registers great fear.  Birdson slides knife back.  Maya sees blood on her hands coming from a c on her fingers.  She trembles, but doesn't run.  Maya use the humility and calm of an experienced exorcist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper) Henry, Christ loves you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birdson looks at her with the impassive, malignant gaze o snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ can save you, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birdson shakes his head as Maya's dangling cross picks of particles of pure light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just say his name, say his name and you'll be free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birdson, agitated, moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soothing) Say his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly traverses the air in front of her face with his knife.  Maya steps back, trapped, her eyes never leaving Birdson's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with love) Christ loves you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a SPLIT SECOND, the real Henry Birdson appears, then smiles grotesquely and in a new VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lascivious) Yes, but does he swallow?

dialogues.speaker: VERY FAST
dialogues.text: Maya dives out the door.  With a SNARL, Birdson recovers lunges for her.  INT. MASTER BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya throws herself back into the bedroom, SLAMMING the d shut behind her as Birdson's body smashes into it.  Maya Birdson's shadowy form trying to break the glass with an animal-like fury.  Scrambling against his mounting pressu Maya tries but fails to get the lock to close.  The door SHUDDERS, as Birdson pummels it with his body.  Birdson CRACKS the glass.  A spiderweb of shards rips through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (different VOICES) Fucking bitch!  Open the door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya drops Lareaux's book, shouldering her weight against door.  He hits it so hard, it opens.  Maya shoves it back and, straining, manages to lock it.  At the same moment, realizes there's no more pressure on the other side.  She stops pushing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over her shoulder, we see the door behind her slightly op She turns and realizes this, takes two steps toward that and then freezes.  Maya's in the center of the room, equidistant from all the doors.  She looks back at the door to the bathroom.  No shadows b the light at its base.  Ever so slowly, keeping her eyes the bathroom door, she reaches over, unlocks and then pul open the door to the hall.  It swings open silently.  She strains, listening as hard as she can.  But the only soun she can hear is her own shallow breathing.  She says a si prayer.  Then steps gingerly toward the door to the hallw As she takes a second step: Birdson BURSTS through the bathroom door behind her.  He leaps and slashes at her, cutting her arm as she bolts through the door to the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...flying into the:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where - WHAM! - she collides full tilt with a body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AHHHH!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Peter.  They hit the ground, groggy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the...OH SHIT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birdson races in, knife held high.  Peter grabs the small reading table and uses it as a shield as they scramble to their feet.  Whipping the knife back and forth at lighten speed, Birdson corrals them into a corner.  It takes all Peter's skill to keep him at bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dawning realization) Peter, let go of the chair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birdson menacingly circles left, then right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LET GO OF THE CHAIR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Birdson makes another thrust towards them, Maya sudden jerks the chair away, clearing a path for Birdson's knife hit Peter's abdomen. Peter SCREAMS, bracing himself for the impact, an impact never comes. Birdson freezes, stopping the thrust millimeters from Pet stomach.  He's caught in an unseen trap, paralyzed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insistent) He can't hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that split second, Peter realizes Maya's right.  He ta the chair and SMASHES Birdson in the head.  Birdson goes down.  Peter kicks him.  He doesn't move.  Peter grabs Birdson's knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Maya) You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's your birthday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back at Maya, who's holding her upper arm.  Bloo begins to drip down her side.  Peter immediately grabs ho of her hand, carefully pushing her arm up in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, get it up, go on, higher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your 33rd birthday.  The transformation will be a perversion of Christ's rising from the dead.  Townsend discovered it in one of Lareaux's books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter goes to the window, grabs one of the lightweight curtains and uses the knife to shred a piece.  He takes i and bandages Maya's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll happen at the exact time of your birth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he stops) That can't be right. (as he ties off the dressing) My birthday's tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Peter and Maya in the foreground, we see, although t don't, that Birdson sits up, his eyes open, staring at a point above Maya and Peter.  A horrible rictus smile move across his face.  Birdson's eyes roll back into his head until only white remains.  Then he begins to jerk uncontrollably, his face contorting into one frightening expression after the next.  Peter grabs the fish knife, moving in front of Maya. Birdson's limbs begin to torque out of control.  He convu on the floor then suddenly sits up closer to camera.  His eyes roll back down into a normal position.  His face bec calm.  He looks at Peter and Maya.  A horrified look cros Birdson's face as his arm rotates backwards, bones snappi and muscles ripping. Involuntarily spewing from Birdson in ever-changing anima like voices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Latin) My demon of anguish, help me create confusion and suffering forever and ever... and ever...(geni tormentorum, mihi commoventi perturbationem miseriamque in saaecula saeculorum, in saecula saeculorum, in saecula saeculorum...)

dialogues.speaker: ECU
dialogues.text: Birdson's head turns on his neck in unnatural manner, his body still convulsing.  As he stops speaking, his head sn back around so he's facing Peter and Maya. Suddenly, the chandelier above them flickers, the globes EXPLODING and showering them with shards of glass.  Birds entire body begins to vibrate, urine seeping out from ben him.  Then, horrifyingly, a horn like protusion begins to push out from the upper edge of Birdson's head, growing, straining...until finally the horn BURSTS through blowing head apart.  Birdson falls back onto the floor.  And as Birdson finally dies, Peter looks at the corpse, then dro heavily onto an arm of a chair.  Drained, Maya sits next him.  They lean against one another, together in trauma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He couldn't stop us and that's how he was punished. (insistent) Peter, what time were you born?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. (pulls in a breath, overwhelmed) Probably have a copy of my birth certificate...my apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's Range Rover moves at a fast clip down side street and back roads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Highway's dark, except for Peter's headlights, as they ro up and down a hilly back road.  Trees lean in on both sid The effect is eerily like driving in another world. Maya flips through Lareaux's book.  A bible she took from Townsend's house sits on her lap.  Looks over at Peter a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing else here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the bible for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter shrugs.  He starts to drive poorly.  His fatigue is showing.  Maya looks up as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead, the road begins to parallel a lake.  Glimpses o black water can be seen through the trees.  She powers do her window to get some air.  Maya looks over at Peter.  H face appears normal.  Then, she seems to hear a soft soun GASPING FOR BREATH.  Then: The car suddenly drifts into the other lane, heading stra for a guard rail which outlines the lake.  Instinctively, Maya lunges for the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She manages to twist it just enough so the car misses the rail, but careens off the road.  The car RIPS through the bushes with an EXPLOSIVE ROAR an SKIDS down the bank and plunges into the lake below.  And

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An enormous SPLASH of water as Peter's car disappears int the lake, the water BUBBLING and as we go under, we see t windshield CRACK and SPLINTER and then we HEAR a ROUGH SCREECH of brakes.  A horrendous long skid and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car has come to a final stop, sitting sideways in the middle of the road, leaving huge skid marks behind it.  T windshield's untouched.  The road empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's breathing hard.  Maya's trembling, her hands on t wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's the matter with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya pops her seat belt and bolts from the car, leaning against the door, her breathing still LABORED.  Peter get out, moving around to her.  He sees she's having difficul breathing.  She chokes out a cough.  His anger turns to concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Sometimes, when I feel weak, I have these...visions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see things.  My worst fears.  You need to know something, Peter.  I was possessed once.  Like Birdson.  It took Father Lareaux six days to pull me out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter grabs hold of her, an impulsive move, ambiguous in intent and unknown even the Peter, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared I'm slipping back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared himself) We're going to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a smile emerges) That's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just past midnight.  A small, dirty white stucco and wood country mart.  The only light is a stark, household flood TWO PEOPLE leave the market, carrying a six pack and a fe munchies.  They hop into their car and take off. And at the edge of the lot, Peter's car is parked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Maya SNAP the lids of their coffees.  Somewhere radio is ON.  Maya moves to the AGING CASHIER as Peter wa over to a wall of generic first-aid remedies.  HE grabs t largest band-aids there.  And as he joins Maya at the counter, we see it's the cashier's radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cashier looks them over as he turns up the volume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Now this daylight thing is up to two minutes and scientists say sooner or later, we'll be losing like fifteen minutes a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rings them up) Five-twelve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter pays.  Out of pennies, the cashier pulls out a new and bangs it open inside of the register.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'll never be on time for work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Maya sit on the edge of the curb, sipping coffe Maya pulls out her cigarettes and lights up.  She offers the pack.  He gratefully takes one, lights up and inhales

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you lie to me about your parents' deaths?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was desperate.  I knew you wrote about murders.  I needed a way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a car motors toward them.  Just as a DEER decide cross the two-lane road.  The car's HIGH BEAMS startle th deer, it stops, snaps a stunned look at Peter and Maya. moment of stillness, then it gallops to safety just as th car speeds by.  Suddenly, quiet again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close call.  For the first time in a long time, it's really hitting me.  Life's tenuous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it is.  Right after my parents died, I went to the beach... (short intake of breath) I was in the water.  Everything was calm.  And then one of those really big waves hit me.  Hard.  Pulled me straight to the bottom.  I struggled and finally ran out of air. (gulps air) If it hadn't been for my sister who pulled me out, I would've drowned.  Legally dead for a couple of minutes is what they told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No oxygen to the brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's my problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you just go along with Townsend.  Get rid of me.  I would've...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until it happens, you're still a human being.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about after?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only your body will remain.  I believe your soul will be at peace.  If we kill you, Satan can't stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She see him react to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens.  It's dark, except for the luminescence o Peter's aquarium.  We see some of the fish are listing an the aquarium still has a slow leak.  The floor's wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire, are you home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SNAPS on the light.  Silent.  Stuffy.  He opens a wind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More air.  Always a good thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's box of records is on the bed where he left it.  T ancient news articles are scattered.  Some fallen onto th floor. Peter picks everything up as Maya sifts the contents on t bed.  We see passing glimpses of a passport, bankbooks, insurance policies, a will, a set of keys, and then a parchment copy of Peter's birth certificate.  Maya picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time of Peter's birth is 4:55 PM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow afternoon.  Four forty-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter absorbs this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (false bravado) Plenty of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fingers set of keys in box) What are these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Extra apartment keys.  What's it matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate) Maybe I should check Lareaux's book.  It's in the car.  Be right back.  Don't go anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya leaves the room.  Moments later, Peter hears the fro door open and close.  Doesn't move, then, suddenly, in a flurry of anger, he knocks the phone off the bedside tabl A lamp flies off with it.  Then he stands and sweeps his across the top of his bureau, knocking off pictures, mome a jewelry box.  Turning, he flips over a chair and kicks viciously. Breathing hard, he slumps back on the bed.  Across the ro he sees a picture of Claire has slipped partially behind bureau.  Its glass has shattered and only half her face i visible. Peter immediately picks it up.  Stares down at this smili girlfriend.  He lays it carefully back on the bureau, try to regain some control.  He breathes deep, then begins gathering everything back on to the bed.  He looks at the of keys.  Picks them up.  Compares them with his own set. Trying to think, he stares out his bedroom window at the building ledge across the way.  He SEES the potted gerani now arranged, a simple red flourish. Then a light snaps on in the apartment below and as he lo down, noticing it, his eyes shift, a momentary realizatio and he looks back down at the keys and leaves his apartme

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter gets on.  He looks at the unknown keys again.  Then pushes the button for the fourth floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter knocks softly on the door.  Then more loudly.  No response.  He tries on of the new keys, slowly giving it turn.  It works.  He tries the lower lock.  The click of key is audible as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open to a dark apartment.  Peter stands warily at the door, then flips on the lights.  Nothing th No furniture.  No occupance. Peter steps in and closes the door.  He looks around at t emptiness.  A cockroach scurries across the floor in fron him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks through the living room and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a small table and lamp have been left in the corner. Peter switches on the lamp.  He notices the ceiling's bee dropped.  A grid of white tile panels, held by a lightwei metal frame.  He stares at it. Very slowly he raises the broom upward and pokes on of th panels.  It moves easily.  He pushes harder and manages t angle the panel, sliding it back, so that some of the original ceiling is visible.  He sees: A lurid splash of color, a tiny fragment of white line, a part of a strange design. Peter stares hard at it.  He grabs the small table from t corner and drags it to the center of the room.  Standing it, he can now easily reach the tiles with his hands. He SMASHES the panels loose, KNOCKING THEM OUT and droppi them on the floor.  Two, three, four more tiles.  Then fi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor below him is littered with ceiling tiles.  Pete looks up at:

dialogues.speaker: CEILING
dialogues.text: An enormous PENTACLE.  Nine feet wide.  It sprawls across ceiling.  Runic symbols crest its edges.  For a moment, Peter's mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door of Apt. 4-A is thrown open.  Peter takes off, leaving the door ajar behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door is thrown open.  Peter steps in to see: Maya, standing, slightly tense, talking to somebody.  The other VOICE is obscured by the sound of a garbage truck moving down the street.  And as Peter moves farther insid past the door, he sees: Claire, sitting on the overstuffed chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gets up) There you are!  My God, darling, I've been so worried.  Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the person...you were talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter holds out the keys to Claire, ignoring Maya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  What are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found them in your file box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be a spare set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought the spare set was in the kitchen drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Claire) You were hiding them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire gets up, moving to Peter, and reaches to embrace h He lets it happen, but doesn't reciprocate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you're exhausted.  Do you want to lie down for a little while?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving across the room) I found the pentacle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya's eyes widen with alarm.  She turns quickly toward Claire who's watching them.  And as Peter follows Maya's stare, in one slow move, Claire pulls a Beretta from a dr in the aquarium table.  She points the gun directly at Ma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's been stalking you, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're going to kill her?  Put the gun down Claire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire ignores him, but before she can make her move, Pet has grabbed her wrist, twisting her back into the living room, trying to pull the gun out of her hand.  Claire wre free of Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, I love you, Peter, I'm trying to protect you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really had me going, Claire.  I was finally ready to propose to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're still going to be together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing you can do about it.   (to Maya) I've fucking had it with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lunges at Maya, one powerful move, but as she does, M moves out of the way.  And as Maya spins around, Claire g for her again, but she trips on the wet floor, losing her balance.  As Peter grabs to catch her, she crashes horrib through the glass shelves. Peter is horrified. Then he walks to Claire and pulls the gun from her lifele hand.  Maya and Peter stare at each other in shock for a moment.  Then Maya's pager sounds.  She checks the number goes to the phone and dials.  As she does, Peter pulls a blanket off the sofa and covers Claire's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, it's me.  What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She listens, and her expression changes to one of relief. She hangs up the phone and turns to Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lareaux...he's coming out of it.  Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car passes through the nearly deserted streets.  A ST SWEEPER passes, brushes whirring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the sunlight prisms on dew-covered grass, Peter and Ma pull into the seminary parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small crowd of priests, including Father Frank, is in t room.  Several stand next to the bed, blocking a clear vi of Father Lareaux.  Soft CLASSICAL MUSIC plays.  The mood upbeat.  As the door opens, Father Frank sees Maya lead P in by the arm like a puppet or a lost soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vindictively) I'm glad you're here.  There's something you need to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With only a cursory glance at Peter, he leads Maya to the bed.  The other priests move away.  Father Lareaux is sit up against his pillows.  He looks good, rosy cheeked - al back to normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happy to see her) Miette...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya throws her arms around his neck, smiling for the fir time in a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father!  Thank God you're better!  I really need your help.  We've only got a few more hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry...about the transformation, Maya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean "don't worry?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (being careful not to wound her) Well, in my prayers, I realized we've been fooling ourselves and probably... blown this all out of proportion.  God would never allow anything like that to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya is floored.  Father Frank looks at her scornfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you this was myth all along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Does that mean it's over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lareaux nods a "yes" at Peter, as Maya sits on the old priest's bed.  Peter stands beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...we won?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweet smile) Yes.  We won, that's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya plays with her cross, distractedly, rocking it back forth between her fingers.  Lareaux re-fluffs his pillows looking away from Maya, moving slightly, making himself m comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won because Christ...triumphed over Satan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um hm.  That's right, Maya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, if Christ won, that means, what does that mean, Father?  That Satan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tenderly, swallowing back) Would you like to rest, Miette?  You must be exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya picks up a scapular from the dresser and moves in cl to Lareaux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insistent) So I guess Satan lost.  Satan is the weak one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breath coming in shorter bursts) Miette, come here and relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya is crowding Lareaux now, the scapular thrust almost directly in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (repeating, monotone) I can relax, because Satan the coward, trembles before Christ, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Frank moves over to Maya with another Priest.  See Lareaux is having trouble breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  That's enough for now.  He's just recovering.  Take it easy, Maya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Maya resists their tugging arms, leaning closer to Lareaux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But doesn't he tremble, Father?  Doesn't he cower, like a frightened jackal?  Satan, the half-wit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya continues, taunting, her cross dangling over Lareaux

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as slowly as she can) The whimpering slave of Christ!  The impotent dog on God's leash!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya thrusts the scapular onto Father Lareaux's forehead. recoils violently, as though burned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vicious, another voice) HE'LL MAKE CHRIST CRAWL!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire room stares, transfixed, at Lareaux.  Maya loo peter, then Father Frank, as she moves carefully off the  INT. FATHER LAREAUX'S ROOM - SHORT TIME LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nervous Father Frank is supervising the Jesuits as they empty Lareaux's room of its extraneous contents.  He avoi looking at Maya.  Father Lareaux sits calmly in a chair a the center of the room.  None of the Jesuits meet his eye One Priest tapes the curtains closed over the window.  A provides the only light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Maya stand anxiously near the door, waiting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's our best chance.  If we can get him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without realizing it, she's touching her shirt cuffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emphatically) You have to be experienced to do this.  Just wait outside. Otherwise, you risk killing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya looks at him, then clasps his hand briefly.  She bre off and walks over to Father Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have the experience.  Father Thomas should officiate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Thomas, a tall Jesuit in his forties, strides down hall.  He's dressed in a long black cassock, with surplice and purple stole.  He's resolute.  Two other Jesuits, Father Malcolm and Father Jeremy, follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me Father, for I have sinned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priests enter and begin to prep the room.  Father Mal goes to the closet and takes out the briefcase we saw at Birdson's exorcism.  He opens it and takes out a bible, a cross a vial of Holy Water. We see Father Thomas don his cassock and scapular in the partitioned dressing area of Father Lareaux's room.  Maya enters.  Peter, from the doorway, sees her lock eyes with Lareaux.  Finally, she turns away.  Lareaux's smile widen Father Thomas steps out from Behind the partition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tie him to the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Thomas makes the Sign of the Cross.  Then, he plac the tip of his stole on Lareaux's neck, and his right han Lareaux's head.  Lareaux flinches.  Father Thomas places relics of the Saints on Lareaux's chest.  He writhes as i pain.  Father Thomas sprinkles Lareaux with Holy Water.  Lareaux reacts as though it were burning oil.  Finally, Father Thomas kneels, beginning the Litanies of the Saint in Latin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last thing Peter sees as the door closes is Maya.  Serious, tight, professional and outside the door, Father Frank is already mouthing his rosary:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Father Frank) Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing we can do but pray.  We'll be in the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Frank leads the other Jesuits down the hall.  With seconds, Peter's alone.  He looks at the door.  Then he slowly moves closer to it, until he's a foot away He tries to listen.  Nothing.  He leans even closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Latin) Behold the Cross of the Lord.  Depart, enemies!  Unclean spirits, and all your companions, I command you.   Tell me your name!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...by the love and power of Christ, who has redeemed man from your grasp, I command you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter moves away and sits down on a bench in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen Jesuits of mixed race, including Father Frank.  Chant prayers in Latin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is sitting on the bench.  He HEARS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, Peter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down the corridor.  He sees no one.  He looks in other direction and sees a JANITOR eating a sandwich and pouring a container of MILK into a large glass.  Once aga he hears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, Peter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the door to Lareaux's room and sees the WALL BREATH IN AND OUT AS IF IT'S ALIVE.  He runs to the door puts his ear against it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...be gone and leave this child of the Lord God almighty.  Be gone, by the power of Christ.  Be gone, by the power of the Holy Spirit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the imprint of a chair pushes against the wall a will burst right through.  Peter jumps away.  He approach the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the name of Christ, I command you.  Tell me your name!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a body slams into the wall which starts to rippl if a subterranean shape were moving through it.  The body appears to be climbing straight up the wall. There's an explosion of NOISE, shrieking and shouting, th sounds of furniture being violently overturned.  Peter is mesmerized and scared.  Hateful VOICES SWELL UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late, too late, too late, too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter touches the door knob to Lareaux's room.  It is FREEZING COLD, so cold it burns.  He pulls his hand away wraps his jacket around his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is torn.  His hand again moves to the doorknob.  Another body SLAMS into the wall.  More NOISE cries of PA ANGER...and pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move, move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
