dialogues.text: A GROWLING ANIMAL is heard, like a BABOON SHRIEKING.  Pet starts to turn the knob, then stops.  He's caught, unsure until Maya calls out in agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, help me.  Oh God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter flings the door open and steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AND THEN VERY FAST.  The door SLAMS behind Peter and Lock itself tight.  Then, Peter sees: The room is not destroyed.  The room is FREEZING COLD, br is visible.  Lareaux is tied to the chair.  Father Thomas standing over him, with a crucifix in hand, the Eucharist Lareaux's head.  Maya and the younger Priests are kneelin just behind Father Thomas, overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotcha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lamp immediately goes out.  Room is pitch black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy, the door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear FUMBLING grunting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It...I can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continue subbing, in Latin) Lowly beast, through the power of Christ.  Let the door re-open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOICES begin.  MOCKING, speeded up versions of sentences we've heard before, LATIN and ENGLISH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Peter's voice) Go on.  Do something.  Show me. (in Maya's voice) I'm scared I'm slipping back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.  Then a normal voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TORRENT OF PROFANITY drowns him out.  A thousand voices young and old, crying, cursing, filling the air with hatr and spite.  Amidst this hurricane of sound, the lights be to flicker at ultra-high speed, creating a strobe effect. The window bursts open, flooding the room with light.  Fa Jeremy races over and struggles to close it, but cannot.  Maya is revealed praying, eyes open.  Peter and Father Malcolm are crouched near the door.  A terrified Father Thomas is bravely standing, holding his crucifix in front himself, facing Lareaux.  Or where Lareaux was.  The chai empty  Amid the deafening noise, Peter sees: Lareaux rise up behind Maya and encircle her throat with hands as the HELLISH VOICES reach a crescendo.  Lareaux begins to sing softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rock-a-bye baby, on a tree top...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter leaps to pull Lareaux off her, but the aging priest surprised Peter by grabbing him and hold him at bay.   As Peter struggles, Lareaux's expression shifts.  His confidence vanishes and pain distorts his features.  Lare falls to the floor in agony.  Maya and Peter bend down to help him, but the noise makes impossible for them to hear one another.  Maya pulls open Lareaux's collar to try to get him more air and in that instant, the VOICES STOP.  The lights POP on.  Maya leans close to Lareaux, who's dying on the floor, MUMBLING incoherently.  And on Lareaux's forehead, we see incision resembling strange, unknown letters.  Like they've been c from within.  The incisions are repeated on the backs of Lareaux's hands.  The room is so cold, steam pops off the breath.  Father Thomas moves fast, beginning the last rit in Latin.  He makes the sign of the Cross on Lareaux's forehead, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lareaux, in Latin) Confiterisne vitia tua ante omnipotentem deum?  (Do you confess your sins before almighty God?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the ark sank, the sun set, the ark sank again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperately) Father, please don't die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in great suffering) ...art sank, sun set, ark sank again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya leans down, inches from the dying priest.  Peter mov beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a split second, Lareaux surfaces from his confusion a looks at her with a great kindness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ensemble pour toujours quoi qu'il arrive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he dies, Maya is momentarily inert, tears of exhaustio She's devastated. And we HEAR a single GRACE NOTE laced w an intake of BREATH as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's CHAOS as Jesuits rush in and out of the cell, helpin the exorcism participants.  Father Frank glares at Maya, he helps clear the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking down at Maya) I thought you were in danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya backs away from Lareaux, who is being covered with a white sheet.  A last glance and then she takes off with Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya looks straight ahead, trying to shake off her fear.  Peter looks at Maya, moved by her.  Puts an arm around he shoulder, a momentary intimacy, then he pulls away.  Fina Maya looks at Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be all right. (reflective) Peter, at the very end, I think Father was back.  I saw it in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what does it mean.  The ark sank and the sun set?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been repeating that since Birdson's exorcism.  I looked in every passage in the Bible and there's nothing about an ark or a sunset that tells us anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say to you in French?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's his, I don't know, his 'grounding' phrase for me, "together, no matter what."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deep sigh) Terrific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Range Rover enters a blue-collar residential part of city, old townhouses on both sides of the street.  The traffic is heavy and the Rover slows, pulling to the curb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter studies Maya, admiring her in some new way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was trying to tell me something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cynical) And his message was  "Together, no matter what?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car pulls up alongside them.  The driver, a middle-aged WOMAN, rolls down her window and calls out to Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helloooo - do you live around here? (Peter ignores her) How do I get to the turnpike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car behind her HONKS impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERE'S FIVE FUCKING CARS BEHIND YOU, ASSHOLE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter turns to the woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't give a shit) Lady, I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Offended, the woman drives off.  Peter turns back to Maya who's suddenly grabbed Townsend's Bible and furiously fli through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.  The message.  He used French, he knew he couldn't say it directly.  The arc "sank" or "cinq" c-i n-q.  It's French for five.  The sun "set" or pronounced like "sept".  The French word for seven.  The arc "sank" again. (then) It's five-seven-fie.  Book chapter and verse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finally stops at a specific section she was looking f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Book five, Deuteronomy, chapter seven, verse five. (reads) "But this shall you deal with them.  You shall break down their altars and burn their graven images with fire."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Range Rover pulls up.  Peter gets out.  He's got a fi gallon gas can.  Maya enters the gas station MINI-MART. clock reads 4:05.  Afternoon NEWS plays on a TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An international group of scientists will assemble in Geneva later this week in an attempt to determine the cause of diminishing daylight, a phenomenon which has baffled the world's finest scientific minds.  In local news, the case of accused killer George Viznick ended in a mistrial today.  Prosecutors vowed to press for a new trial immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya hands the clerk some money and glances outside at Pe filling the gas can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks quiet and serene in the afternoon light.  Peter Maya approach carefully.  They see a collection of cars i front of the church.  Unkempt and dirty, a few pedestrian stare at them.  The gas bumps conspicuously against Maya' thigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter pulls out Claire's gun.  They step inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Maya pass through the vestry and edge their way into the main cathedral.  A MASS is in progress.  A lay READER has memorized the text.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God appears and God is light to those pour souls who dwell in night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Maya move in suddenly from the vestry, onto the altar, behind the reader.  Maya's shocked by the packed-t capacity church.  The crowd inside immediately switch the focus to Maya and then to Peter, who's just moved up onto altar, standing unknowingly directly under the CROSS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But does a human form display...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reader sees the stares from the crowd, stops, and tur to Maya and Peter.  The reader is wearing a small inverte cross around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the crowd, Maya sees the little girl from the diner. is stunned.  The little girl catches Maya's glance, givin her a sly smile and then looks away.  Her mother appears beside her.  Unnerved, Maya looks at Peter, desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, the priest at the front of the church, standing qui next to the reader, turns slowly toward Peter, oddly very calm.  And we see it's Father James.  He smiles.  Charmin gracious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at gas can) Did you really think you could just burn the church down.  That some ritualistic hocus pocus could just end this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarmed, Peter looks at Maya, but her gaze is locked on James.  Then Peter glances down at the dripping gasoline in Maya's hand and as she sets it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lareaux was never free of us.  He led you here. (he starts to sing softly) "Get me to the church on time."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter moves toward James, putting the gun to his uncle's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely able to stand it) You fucking bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you get it? (re: Maya) They had their 2,000 years.  Now it's our turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So all that bullshit about God and faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was perfect.  The harder I pushed, the more you pulled away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beyond anger, beyond tears) You lied to me my whole life.  Everything you said, everything you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything I did, I did for you.  I love you, Peter.  Think of it.  I'm giving you a gift, absolute power and knowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You raised me, like a son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are my son.  Don't you see the opportunity that lies before you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting it together) You killed my parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to.  There was no other way.  Their deaths were part of the greatest legacy I could have given you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter moves the muzzle of the gun into James' carotid art

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: The realization floods her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't!  That's what they want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be my ultimate sacrifice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you commit murder, you accept evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one, people in the congregation begin to rise.  Pe can't believe what he sees.  Susan and Mrs. Quintana. Stunned, Peter lets the gun lower a moment and then, as h turns back to Maya, he's too late.  James has moved behind Maya, holding a long-bladed knife her throat.  James anchors it at her neck, forming a shimmering upside down Cross, Runic symbols carved into t Sterling handle. Peter pivots, pulling up the gun again, aiming it back at James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cocks the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's going to die right in front of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter looks at Maya.  Her expression gives him the permis to do the unthinkable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Let him kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's thrown off.  Maya lets her eyes blink closed.  Fo moment, no one moves.  The knife glints off the stained glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter.  Thinking.  Unraveling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big smile) You have no idea how much you look like your mother right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter FIRES, an ECHOING REPORT, bouncing from the Cathedr ceiling to the Travertine floor.  Father James falls, mortally wounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you thought I was the family fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter sees William approaching from the pews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Maya.  You served us well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned, Peter gulps a mouthful of air, lifts his gun and shoots William in the eye.  Immediate.  The bullet powers through William, lodging in Mrs. Quintana.  She COUGHS up GURGLING choke, eyes wide.  And as she dies gripping her neck, she doubles over the back of a wooden pew. The crowd reacts.  Maya grabs hold of Peter edging him ba toward the vestry and out of the church.  As the Congrega starts to press forward, Peter swings the gun back up and toward them.  It glistens off the Chalices.  They stop, w and as Maya and Peter finally turn their backs on the cro they take off past the sacred Eurcharistic relics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the vestry and out the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Maya sprint for the Rover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Maya speed up the street.  They turn the corner continue up a street undergoing construction.  Fenced by sawhorse barricades, it's equipped with flashing warning lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time do we have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter races past the barricades, side-swiping the steel sawhorses, then suddenly he slams on the brakes, skidding a rough stop, nowhere to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter looks at Maya, then at the gun in his lap and back her.  Conflicted emotions.  He picks up the revolver.  Ma stares at Peter.  A huge fear rips through her body.  Pet hesitates.  Then hands her the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can do it...go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya puts the gun down.  Leans over and embraces him.  Th hold onto each other.  A shared intimacy, unknown to eith of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a desperate whisper) I'm not strong enough for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter reaches over and tenderly brushes the hair away fro Maya's face.  Then Maya pulls away, raising the tiny gun TIME slows to a crawl. Maya holds the Beretta.  The strain etched on her face, h hands shake, her eyes well up.  Peter waits, watching her She's unsure.  We HEAR a choked back breath.  Gasping, lu looking for air.  The struggle for life. The car clock seems frozen on 4:54.  Finally, it turns ov and... Nothing happens. Peter's looking at her.  He knows.  He's sure of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't work!  Maya, I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter reaches for her, his face radiant, joyful, alive. doesn't move a muscle.  The gun barrel doesn't quiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changed tone) It's me.  Put the gun down.  Maya...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears roll down her face, as she cocks the Beretta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you really think I'm the Devil, then shoot me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the corner of her eye, Maya sees the clock - its h rapidly spin backward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HIGH ANGLE of the car from above.  A SHOT RIPS through air.  Then one more.  Maya exits the car.  She's unsteady her feet.  The camera pans up into the night sky. SILENCE. Followed by a low-pitched, disturbing rumble.  A kind of GROTESQUE GROAN.  Then some HUM is heard.  Static.  A not quite-tuned in radio station becomes audible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love this, now scientists are saying the days have suddenly stopped getting shorter.  It makes you wonder.  Do these guys know anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station fades out.  There's a FRAGMENT of POP MUSIC, STATIC, then the RADIO'S SNAPPED OFF.  And we hear the so of breathing, light and steady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An aerial shot of a steel blue car as it cruises down a t lane highway.  Passing fields of cotton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the car, Maya is driving.  Windows down.  She look serene, at peace, carrying her wound well as we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya aims at Peter's head and pulls the trigger.  Peter's thrown back against the seat.  She fires again into his heart.  Maya lets the gun down slowly.  Tears streak her cheeks, as she cups his face in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: SILENCE
dialogues.text: Followed by a LOW-PITCHED, DISTURBING RUMBLE, a kind of GROTESQUE GROAN.  Then some HUM is heard.  STATIC.  A not quite-tuned-in radio station becomes audible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love this, now scientists are saying the days have suddenly stopped getting shorter.  It makes you wonder.  Do these guys know anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station fades out.  There's a FRAGMENT of POP MUSIC, STATIC, then the RADIO'S SNAPPED OFF.  And we hear the so of breathing, light and steady.
